title: Patient Transporter Interview
Interview Descriptions: Go through HR and then to department manager. Most questions are about hours of work as you have to be flexible about weekends and working 2nd and 3rd shifts and holidays which is normal for a hospital
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at AnMed

title: Office Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AnMed Health in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a formal interview with behavioral questions that were asked. It was leadership present with a provider present also. Asked a lot of questions in regards to my background. I was also given a tour of the office and was able to meet some of the employees i would be working with.
Interview Questions: What would you do in the first 5 days you were hired ?

title: Patient Care Technician- CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Nurse Manager discussing job, hours, my experience/goals/schedule, work environment, etc. followed by an interview with HR, drug test/health screening, and orientation. Hospital is desperate for employees and will hire anyone with a heartbeat
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a work conflict and how you solved it

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, positive experience. Standard interview questions (Ex. describe a time where you faced conflict in the work place). Interview took place soon after I submitted application, hired soon after that
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you faced conflict in the workplace, what is your biggest weakness..

title: Dialysis Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Typical Interview, met with HR immediately following the interview. Nurse manager was very kind and personable at interview, taking me on a tour of the unit and answering all of my questions
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you faced conflict with a co-worker, how did you handle it?

title: Business Intelligence Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Great, easy interview process, very kind people at AnMEd. Process was not too time consuming like other Organizations. Very pleased with the way the interview was conducted and the ease of the process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have using Epic?

title: Emergency Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back and relaxed. It was more of getting to know each other and just talking. Would have liked if the process could have moved quicker. But overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with communicating with multiple levels of employees?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC)
Interview Descriptions: job applied and job offered hours differed The  Supervisor was nice. first met with HR then was sent to meet the security supervisor and his second in command. They asked alot of questions but were vague with theirs answers if they were asked any.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at AnMed Health
Interview Descriptions: Very discriminatory hiring process. Interview was wonderful and department all but verbally offered the job, but then weeks later strings were pulled for another candidate and I lost my opportunity.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, yet informative.  The manager was helpful explaining the hiring process and what to expect in the upcoming days.  I interviewed through human resources, the department management and then was offered the job the following week.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at AnMed Health
Interview Descriptions: only asked why I want to work at patient transporter walked around hospital with supervisor and co-workers, they showed you what they do during the day and answered questions, discussed what you do during the and work schedule,
Interview Questions: why do you want to work as patient trasporter

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AnMed Health in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for informal. I was brought into the Case Management Director's office for a 30 minute interview session. The interview felt very personal and I had an opportunity to open up about my past experiences working with individual with disabilities. I was able to learn more about the director and what strategies she personally brings daily to working at Health South.
Interview Questions:
Q: How would you diffuse an argument amongst family members if the members disagreed about the treatment plan?

Q: How would you handle a patient with a mental illness that was acting erratic? 

Q: How do you respond under pressure?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AnMed Health
Interview Descriptions: This was the easiest interview I had ever been on. I was asked basic interview questions, mostly questions I had already answered on the online application. I was finished the interview in less than thirty minutes. I really just spent time talking about myself, based on many of the personal questions I was asked. I honestly believe the decision was made to hire me, before the interview because of my previous experience.
Interview Questions: what was the most challenging thing on previous job

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AnMed Health in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: You have to submit your resume and application online including all of your certifications and credentials.  It is very important to put that you are BLS certified.  The interview consists of an HR background check, drug screen, lab work, and physical test.  The interview with the unit is scheduled after your resume has been reviewed and you pass all other requirements.  This interview is a group interview in which the nurses, doctors, and nurse managers all interview you together.  You are chosen based on whether the team thinks you are a good fit for them .
Interview Questions: When have you had to deal with conflict?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, received call from HR Representative. Interview set with HR for paperwork, and the met with Nurse Manager of the unit that I applied for. 

About 10 minutes with Nurse Manager, and then peer interview with two RN's from the unit, one of whom was the Charge Nurse (but I was unaware of that at the time). 

The same day, I also interviewed with a Nurse Manager of another unit for which I also applied. Interview was similar except I had no peer interview. I only talked with the Manager and then toured the unit.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to be a nurse?

title: PCT2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at AnMed Health (Anderson, SC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, face to face interview with human resources, then face to face with the nurse manager that introduced me to other employees on the unit, tour of the unit
